definition: Greater China/refers to China, Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macau (esp. in finance and economics)/refers to all areas of Chinese presence (esp. in the cultural field), including parts of Southeast Asia, Europe and the Americas
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

sentences.english: Mr Wu will be in charge of the company development in new business of big China division.
sentences.chinese: 吴先生将负责公司在大中华区新业务的开发。

sentences.english: Mr. Leung will also have the title of chairman for China.
sentences.chinese: 梁念坚还将兼任大中华地区董事长一职。

sentences.english: Versace has opened more than 20 stores in greaterChina.
sentences.chinese: 范思哲在大中华区开设了20多家店面。

sentences.english: The official opening of the Nescafe into the door.
sentences.chinese: 正式开启了雀巢进军大中华的大门。

definition: descendants of the Fiery Emperor and the Yellow Emperor (i.e. Han Chinese people)
without borders (used for organizations such as Médecins sans Frontières)
